title: Couldn't connect to another peer in my geth private chain
body:
I wanna build a geth private network between two Raspberry Pi 3B.
And the IP is 192.168.0.107/109 respectively
The problem is, when I wanna connect them by the instruction admin.addPeer("enode..."), it didn't work. The peerCount remain 0.
Then I save the enode by static-nodes.json in ./privatechain/geth, the result still the same.
Anyone help me with this?

I started the nodes by the following command:
```
sudo geth --datadir="./privatechain" --port 30301 --rpcport 8101 --networkid 4783 console
sudo geth --datadir="./privatechain" --port 30302 --rpcport 8102 --networkid 4783 console
```
And it appears:
```
I0131 21:19:00.114516 ethdb/database.go:83] Allotted 128MB cache and 1024 file handles to /home/pi/privatechain/privatechain/geth/chaindata
I0131 21:19:00.199083 ethdb/database.go:176] closed db:/home/pi/privatechain/privatechain/geth/chaindata
I0131 21:19:00.205552 node/node.go:176] instance: Geth/v1.5.7-stable-da2a22c3/linux/go1.7.4
I0131 21:19:00.205754 ethdb/database.go:83] Allotted 128MB cache and 1024 file handles to /home/pi/privatechain/privatechain/geth/chaindata
I0131 21:19:00.479327 eth/backend.go:191] Protocol Versions: [63 62], Network Id: 4783
I0131 21:19:00.488291 eth/backend.go:219] Chain config: {ChainID: 15312 Homestead: 0 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: false EIP150: 0 EIP155: 0 EIP158: 0}
I0131 21:19:00.494667 core/blockchain.go:217] Last header: #0 [dff3fd03…] TD=1
I0131 21:19:00.494886 core/blockchain.go:218] Last block: #0 [dff3fd03…] TD=1
I0131 21:19:00.495002 core/blockchain.go:219] Fast block: #0 [dff3fd03…] TD=1
I0131 21:19:00.518752 p2p/server.go:340] Starting Server
I0131 21:19:00.554244 p2p/nat/nat.go:111] mapped network port udp:30302 -> 30302 (ethereum discovery) using NAT-PMP(192.168.0.1)
I0131 21:19:00.968253 p2p/discover/udp.go:227] Listening, enode://4adefa83eaf385b554a6ec444da9a9f09c1112806fde2f2587d746a66aa3ce38326e25449e4898002a48eedab5b1f9213a8c36e9499fac5e9e7607db3a62ddbc@140.116.179.57:30302
I0131 21:19:00.987790 p2p/server.go:608] Listening on [::]:30302
I0131 21:19:01.002189 node/node.go:341] IPC endpoint opened: /home/pi/privatechain/privatechain/geth.ipc
I0131 21:19:01.005667 p2p/nat/nat.go:111] mapped network port tcp:30302 -> 30302 (ethereum p2p) using NAT-PMP(192.168.0.1)
Welcome to the Geth JavaScript console!

instance: Geth/v1.5.7-stable-da2a22c3/linux/go1.7.4
coinbase: 0xa83294bc644087ac671843d530cd969c7db6fb21
at block: 0 (Thu, 01 Jan 1970 08:00:00 CST)
 datadir: /home/pi/privatechain/privatechain
 modules: admin:1.0 debug:1.0 eth:1.0 miner:1.0 net:1.0 personal:1.0 rpc:1.0 txpool:1.0 web3:1.0
```

Providing the `static-nodes.json` files miight have helped -- however, the geth version is _ancient_ -- https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/releases/tag/v1.5.7 it's four hears old. We don't spend time investigating issues in such old versions. If you hit the same thing with a recent version, please either file a new ticket or reopen this.
